results.title: Editing a film: Synge's 'The Well of the saints'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The principles involved in editing a film are explained, using the film version of John M. Synge’s play “THE WELL OF THE SAINTS”. The role of the editor in film production, and the purpose and result of editing, are described, and both proper and improper techniques are illustrated
results.title_for_label: Editing a film: Synge’s ‘The Well of the saints’

results.title: The Edinburgh Festival
results.brief_description: Highlights of the Edinburgh Festivals of 1963 and 1964 closing with one of the most popular items in the Festival, the Military Tattoo on the esplanade of Edinburgh Castle. (Awarded a Cup by the Minister of Tourism, 7th International Festival of Tourist Films, Milan, 1966)

results.title: Edinburgh Festival, 1962
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscope of varied aspects of the international festival of music including art exhibitions, a display of athletics and dancing at Murrayfield, and views of the floodlit Military Tattoo.

results.title: The Edge of the barrens
results.creator_credit: Dalton Muir, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A distinguished film study of the tundra of Canada’s sub-Arctic. It stretches from the polar sea to the southern treeline and supports, despite the permafrost, a surprising variety of life. Here you see the ungainly musk-ox, survivor of the Ice Age, and herds of caribou following the migrant trails; also birds and flowers, smaller animals, and insects. (Awards: Venice; Buenos Aires; Yorkton)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dalton Muir, Hugh O’Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: A distinguished film study of the tundra of Canada’s sub-Arctic. results.title: Edgar Degas
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Sothebys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Shows how Degas turned again and again to two themes, horse-racing and the ballet, and his use of photography as an aid to composition. Written and narrated by Kenneth Clark

results.title: Edgar Allan Poe
results.creator_credit: Stuart O'Brien and Arthur G. Evans
results.brief_description: One of the first American writers of international importance, Poe became a widely read master of the short story, yet his life seemed a fabric of despair, failure, frustration and poverty. This film presents a sympathetic account of Poe’s life and work narrated by Lorne Greene. To conclude there is a reading of Poe’s famous poem, ANNABEL LEE

results.title: Ecosystems and interactions
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Ecology Series”.
Describes the communities of organisms in ecosystems and explains how they interact with one another and the environment in which they live. Ecosystems are inescapably locked together through nutrient cycles and food chains with a common denominator - the sun - as a source of all energy

results.title: The Economics game
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall, Peter Hollander, Journal Films and United Nations Films
